raw_comment:
What do you notice?
The ratio of players of color in each sport is significantly larger than the percentage of coaches. NFL has the largest gap with 61% and MLS has the smallest with 19%. The MLS actually has the largest percentage of head coaches of color. 

What do you wonder?
I wonder if other leagues, especially the European leagues have similar numbers. 

What impact does this have on you and your community?
Young people can look up to the many athletes in the different sports. The athletes do not have many coaches to look up to, from similar background that understands them. Coaching is not diverse.

What’s going on in this graph? Write a catchy headline that captures the graph’s main idea.

You can became a professional player but not a head coach based on your skin color.
ace_sentences: In each sport, the ratio of players of color is larger than the percentage of coaches of color.
In the NFL, the gap is 61%.
In the MLS, the gap is 19%.
The MLS has the largest percentage of head coaches of color.
I wonder if other leagues have similar numbers.
I especially wonder if European leagues have similar numbers.
Young people can look up to many athletes in different sports.
Athletes do not have many coaches of similar background.
A coach of similar background can understand an athlete.
The headline is: You can become a professional player but not a head coach based on your skin color.
